e4: Adopting the new policy improves transparency and aligns with ethical standards in financial reporting. This change enhances credibility and trustworthiness among all investors, mitigates potential legal risks, and promotes equal information distribution to both sophisticated and retail investors, thereby fostering a fairer market environment.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should be transparent, accurate, and consistent, providing all investors with the same information without biases or manipulations. It should comply with legal standards and accounting principles, ensuring that all financial disclosures are truthful and complete. Consideration should be given to facilitating investor understanding, avoiding any practices that could mislead or disadvantage any investor group, particularly less sophisticated retail investors.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team how they plan to communicate and implement the new no-bias policy effectively to ensure that all investors, especially retail investors, are fully aware of the change. Additionally, I would inquire about any potential impacts on stock price and investor relations in the short term, and how these will be managed.
